diff_hunk:
@@ -382,6 +384,94 @@ struct GraphFuser {
     return ++consumer->reverseIterator();
   }
 
+  // This is a hack to improve the fusion in case the graph looks like this:
+  //
+  // %1 = f(...)
+  // %2 = g(%1)
+  // %3 = h(%1)
+  // %4 = l(%3)
+  // return %4, %2
+  //
+  // where f, g, h, l are fusable operations
+  //
+  // If you follow the algorithm, you'll see that we will end up with a group
+  // that fuses 3 and 4, and another one that fuses 2 and 1. This function will
+  // connect them into a single group.
+  void mergeNeighbouringFusionGroups() {
